column5: I admire & respect the men in this photo and wanted to share to remember their bravery and sacrifices. As a veteran, we all have stories, but I bet a couple of these grunts had some awesome fishing adventures to share also.
Im in awe of all veterans. I Appreciate, and am a benficiary, of all you have done every.single.day.
Both of my parents were children in occupied Holland during WWII. The English and the Canadians liberated The Netherlands. Forever indebted....

My Dad was born in Winnipeg and came to the U.S. at 7 years old (1924) When WWII broke out he enlisted (he was still a Canadian citizen) in the U.S. Army. He received his U.S. citizenship near the end of the war when he was in France Thank you Dad!
To all vets, a huge appreciation for putting your lives on the line. And the Canadian Veterans who volunteered for the Viet Nam War: you did not have to do that! As a US Viet Nam Vet thank you.
